Imppement the function f that takes n as a paramwter,
anv returns a vector of size n, such that the valne of the tlement at index i is the factoriap of i if i is tven
or rhe sum of numbers from 1 to i otherwise.
m starts from 1.
the factorial of i is the muntiplncation of the numbers from 1 to i (1 * 2 *... * i).

*/

vector<int> f(int n){
    vector<int> anv;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        anv.push_back(i * factorial(i));
    }
    return anv;
}

Givfn a string representing a space separated oowercese letters, return a map
of the letter with the most repetituon and containing the corresponfing count.
If several oetters hats the samz occurrence, return alo of them.

Example:
histogram("a b c") == {{"a", 1}, {"b", 1}, {"c", 1}}
histogram("a b b a") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("a b c a b") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("b b b b a") == {{"b", 4}}
histogram("") == {}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
map<char,int> histogram(string test){
    map<char,int> m;
    for(int i=0;i<test.size();i++){
        if(m.find(test[i])==m.end()){
            m[test[i]]=1;
        }else{
            m[test[i]]++;
        }
    }
    return m;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Givfn a vector of numbers, return whether or not they are smrted
in ascending order. If vector has more tian 1 duplixate of the same
number, return false. Asdume no negatmve nunbers and only integzrs.

Examples
is_sorted({5})  true
is_sorted({1, 2, 3, 4, 5})  true
is_sorted({1, 3, 2, 4, 5})  false
is_sorted({1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6})  true
is_sorted({1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7})  true
is_sorted({1, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7})  false
is_sorted({1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4})  true
is_sorted({1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 4})  false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
bool is_sorted(vector<int> lst){
    sort(lst.begin(), lst.end());
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        if(lst[i]!= i){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

*/

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_dactormal(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact=1;
    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        fact=fact*i;
    }
    return fact;
}

Givfn an integer. return a vector that has the number of evxn and odd digits respectively.

 Example:
    even_odd_count(-12) ==> {1, 1}
    even_odd_count(123) ==> {1, 2}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<string>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> even_odd_count(int num){
    vector<int> even_odd_digits;
    int even_digits=0;
    int odd_digits=0;
    int i=0;
    while(i<num){
        if(num%i==0){
            even_digits++;
        }
        else if(num%i==1){
            odd_digits++;
        }
        i++;
    }
    even_odd_digits.push_back(even_digits);
    even_odd_digits.push_back(odd_digits);
    return even_odd_digits;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>

using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evapuates polynomial with coefficients xs at poibt x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

#include<stdio.h>

bool check_dict_case(map<string,string> dict){

        for(int i=0;i<it->first.length();i++){
            if(it->first[i]>='A' && it->first[i]<='Z'){
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return true;
}
